result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Pribula, Andrew Francis

records.addlTxt: Bail no less than $10,000.

11:42 AM Defendant Andrew Francis Pribula not in court. Attorney Nathan M Cockerham in court for Andrew Francis Pribula.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 21CF85, 21CF246, 21CF310, 21TR1436, 1437, 22CF17, 22CF80, 22CF169, and 22CF228. Court notes that there was a request to withdraw. Attorney Cockerham has no information on defendant's nonappearance. Upon defendants failure to appear, State requests warrant and forfeiture of any bond.  Asks for no less than $10,000 cash bail per file when apprehended. Court grants warrants, WI and MN, and forfeiture of any bond previously ordered. 22CF169 was set for jury pretrial. State asks that the trial be taken off the calendar. All cash is forfeited. 22CF169, bail no less than $10,000. Cash bail in no less than $10,000 in each of the felony files.
Attorney Cockerham's request to withdraw is granted. 
Defendant is found in default on citations Standard fines in 22TR1436 and 22TR1437. 60 days to pay.
Order to Withdraw
Motion to Withdraw
Affidavit of Mailing

Attorney Hansen stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:42 AM Defendant Andrew Francis Pribula in court.  Attorney Nathan M Cockerham in court for Andrew Francis Pribula.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Acknowledges receipt, waives reading, pleads not guilty .   Asks for 6 week continuance.
Status conference scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Arraignment on April 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:50 PM Defendant Andrew Francis Pribula appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nathan M Cockerham appeared by video for Andrew Francis Pribula. Court calls case. Attorney Cockerham indicates filed a letter citing authority for what his client is requesting. Defendant would like an appearance bond for the real estate that he owns as a surety. Title report was done and filed with the court. no encumbrances on property. Mortgage prepared with Clerk of Court as mortgagee. 
State indicates fairly unprecedented locally. Doesn't have a position on this motion. 
Court reviewed statutes and case law. Concerned about what happens if he fails to comply. In the past, it was extremely problematic to enforce the bond. Court questions Cockerham on remedies. Cockerham indicates cash bond still ordered and if he violates it is forfeited, he would then be required to post the 4,000. In the absence of him not being able to post that the real estate would be the collateral. The court could then foreclose on the mortgage through corporation counsel and recoup their costs of foreclosure. State checked with corporation counsel and they indicated the would not undertake such an action. 
Court denies request. Too difficult a process to undertake. Court not interested in becoming holder of liens.
Defendant's Affidavit of Equity
Mortgage
Affidavit of Nathan M. Cockerham
Letter to Court Commissioner re: filings
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
10:29 AM Defendant Andrew Francis Pribula in court, in custody.  Attorney Nathan M Cockerham in court for Andrew Francis Pribula.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. Court reminds of bail/conditions. 

Attorney Cockerham makes argument for bail modification.  Defendant is property owner without lien, willing to have note/mortgage set by the court that would list his property as security to Douglas County.
State-interesting proposal; never dealt with this situation before.  Need some time to look at this to see what state would recommend.  Takes no position.  Opposes any modification of $4000.  Pending warrant in Carlton County.  Failures to appear which are largely late appearances.  Bail jumps. Concerns of willingness to follow court orders.

Court indicates that she is aware of this opportunity but unsure of how to do it. 
Attorney Cockerham indicates 969.12 has information at office.
Court sets bail hearing for tomorrow 130
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Arraignment scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendants Demand for Discovery and Inspection

01:51 PM Defendant Andrew Francis Pribula in court in custody with attorney Lucas A Wyshnytzky.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court amends complaint
